tit.j: ツキガタプロダクション

sen.j: ツキガタプロダクション（登記上正式表記ツキガタプロタクシヨン、1928年 設立 - 1932年 解散）は、かつて京都、のちに奈良に存在した映画会社である。
sen.e: Tsukigata Production (registered name was Tsukigata Purotakushon, established in 1928, liquidated in 1932) was a movie company once existed in Kyoto and later in Nara.
Tsukigata Productions (registered as Tsukigata Purotakushon, established in 1928, liquidated in 1932) was a film company that existed in Kyoto and then in Nara.
sen.cmt: Production→Productions; changed "registered name was" to "registered as"; changed "movie" to "film"; chnaged "once" to "that"; changed "later" to "then"
sen.e: Tsukigata Productions (registered as Tsukigata Purotakushon, established in 1928, liquidated in 1932) was a film company that existed in Kyoto and then in Nara.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 当時の若手人気俳優「月形陽候」こと月形龍之介が設立した。
sen.e: The company was established by then popular young actor Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA, or "Yoko TSUKIGATA".
The company was established by a popular young actor of the time named Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA, also known as "Yoko TSUKIGATA".

sen.e: The company was established by a popular young actor of the time named Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA, also known as 'Yoko TSUKIGATA.'

sen.j: 8本のサイレント映画と2本のトーキーを製作した。
sen.e: It produced eight silent films and two talkie films.

sen.j: 牧野省三のマキノ・プロダクションの専属俳優だった月形龍之介は、1928年（昭和3年）2月、同社との配給提携を条件に設立したのが、この「ツキガタプロダクション」である。
sen.e: Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA, an actor under contract with Shozo MAKINO's Makino Production, established "Tsukigata Production" in February 1928 on condition of Makino's distribution right.

Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA, an actor under contract with Shozo MAKINO's Makino Productions, established "Tsukigata Productions" in February of 1928 under the condition of giving distribution rights to Makino.
sen.cmt: Makino Production→Makino Productions; Tsukigata Production→Tsukigata Productions; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: Ryunosuke TSUKIGATA, an actor under contract with Shozo MAKINO's Makino Productions, established 'Tsukigata Productions' in February of 1928 under the condition of giving distribution rights to Makino.

sen.j: これを期に「月形陽候」と改名した。

It was at this time that Ryunosuke changed his name to "Yoko TSUKIGATA".

sen.j: 設立第1作は、井上金太郎の「秋篠珊次郎」名義によるオリジナル脚本での監督作『酒毒の剣法』であった。
sen.e: The first film produced by the company was "Shudoku no Kenpo", a film which Kintaro INOUE wrote its scenario under the name of "Sanjiro AKISHINO" and directed by himself.

sen.j: 井上の監督作3本、悪麗之助の監督作を製作し、翌1929年（昭和4年）井上の監督作『剣士沖田総司』を製作して、一度同社を解散した。
sen.e: The company produced three films of director Inoue and one film of director Reinosuke AKU, and it was once liquidated in 1929 after producing director Inoue's "Kenshi Okita Soji".

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）5月、トーキー映画の製作を目指してふたたび独立、奈良の生駒山山麓に撮影所を建設し、「月形プロダクション」とした。
sen.e: In may 1931, Tsukigata became independent once again with the aim of producing talkie films and established "Tsukigata Production" by constructing a studio on the foot of Mt. Ikoma in Nara.

sen.j: 映音のシステム不備でパート・トーキーとなったが、キネマ旬報ベストテンで第5位の高評価を得た。

sen.j: 第2作は映画『スカラムーシュ』（監督レックス・イングラム、1923年）の原作者ラファエル・サバチニの小説を原作に、『暁の市街戦』を製作、今回はP.C.L.映画製作所のシステムでオール・トーキーが可能になった。
sen.e: The second film was "Machi no Shigaisen", a film based on the novel of Rafael Sabatini, the original author of the film "Scaramouch" (directed by Rex Ingram, 1923), and it was an all-talkie film using the system of P.L.C. Eiga Seisakusho.
